ShortSummary: Java enum listing database transaction isolation levels with their JDBC integer codes, including vendor-specific ones.
Summary: IsolationLevel defines transaction isolation constants and their integer IDs (aligning with java.sql.Connection for standard levels), plus extra vendor-specific levels. getLevelId() exposes the numeric value typically passed to JDBC setTransactionIsolation.
MostImportantThings: Maps standard JDBC isolation levels: NONE(0), READ_UNCOMMITTED(1), READ_COMMITTED(2), REPEATABLE_READ(4), SERIALIZABLE(8).
Includes vendor-specific levels: CURSOR_STABILITY(3), LAST_COMMITTED(5), SQL_SERVER_SNAPSHOT(4096).
getLevelId() returns the integer used by JDBC drivers and Connection#setTransactionIsolation.
Likely used within HikariCP to parse/apply the transactionIsolation setting; availability depends on driver support.
RelatedFunctionality: Driver-specific support: DB2 Cursor Stability/Last Committed, SQL Server SNAPSHOT isolation
